verses.verse: Then Job<WH347> answered,<WH6030>
"How long will you torment<WH3013> me,<WH5315> and crush<WH1792> me with words?<WH4405>
You have reproached<WH3637> me ten<WH6235> times.<WH6471> You aren't<WH954> ashamed that you attack me.<WH1970>
If it is true<WH551> that I have erred,<WH7686> my error<WH4879> remains with myself.<WH3885>
If indeed<WH551> you will magnify<WH1431> yourselves against me,<WH3198> and plead against me my reproach;<WH2781>
know<WH3045> now<WH645> that God<WH433> has subverted<WH5791> me,<WH5362> and has surrounded me with his net.<WH4686>
"Behold,<WH6817> I cry out of wrong,<WH2555> but I am not heard.<WH6030> I cry<WH7768> for help,<WH4941> but there is no justice.
He has walled up<WH1443> my way<WH734> so that I can't<WH5674> pass, and has set<WH7760> darkness<WH2822> in my paths.<WH5410>
He has stripped<WH6584> me of my glory,<WH3519> and taken<WH5493> the crown<WH5850> from my head.<WH5850>
He has broken<WH5422> me down on every side,<WH5439> and I am gone.<WH3212> My hope<WH8615> he has plucked<WH5265> up like a tree.<WH6086>
He has also kindled<WH2734> his wrath<WH639> against me.<WH2803> He counts me among his adversaries.<WH6862>
His troops<WH1416> come<WH935> on together,<WH3162> build<WH5549> a siege<WH1870> ramp against me,<WH2583> and encamp around<WH5439> my tent.<WH168>
"He has put<WH7368> my brothers<WH251> far<WH7368> from me.<WH3045> My acquaintances are wholly estranged from me.<WH2114>
My relatives<WH7138> have gone away.<WH2308> My familiar friends<WH3045> have forgotten me.<WH7911>
Those who dwell<WH1481> in my house,<WH1004> and my maids,<WH519> count<WH2803> me for a stranger.<WH2114> I am an alien<WH5237> in their sight.<WH5869>
I call<WH7121> to my servant,<WH5650> and he gives me no answer.<WH6030> I beg<WH2603> him with<WH1119> my mouth.<WH6310>
My breath<WH7307> is offensive<WH2114> to my wife.<WH802> I am loathsome<WH2589> to the children<WH1121> of my own mother.<WH990>
Even young children<WH5759> despise<WH3988> me.<WH6965> If I arise, they speak against me.<WH1696>
All my familiar<WH5475> friends<WH4962> abhor<WH8581> me.<WH157> They whom I loved have turned against me.<WH2015>
My bones<WH6106> stick<WH1692> to my skin<WH5785> and to my flesh.<WH1320> I have escaped<WH4422> by the skin<WH5785> of my teeth.<WH8127>
"Have pity<WH2603> on me,<WH2603> have pity on me,<WH7453> you my friends; for the hand<WH3027> of God<WH433> has touched me.<WH5060>
Why do you persecute<WH7291> me as God,<WH410> and are not satisfied<WH7646> with my flesh?<WH1320>
"Oh that<WH5414> my words<WH4405> were now<WH645> written!<WH3789> Oh that<WH5414> they were inscribed<WH2710> in a book!<WH5612>
That with an iron<WH1270> pen<WH5842> and lead<WH5777> they were engraved<WH2672> in the rock<WH6697> forever!<WH5703>
But as for me,<WH3045> I know that my Redeemer<WH1350> lives.<WH2416> In the end,<WH314> he will stand<WH6965> upon the earth.<WH6083>
After<WH310> my skin<WH5785> is destroyed,<WH5362> then in my flesh<WH1320> shall I see<WH2372> God,<WH433>
Whom I,<WH2372> even I, shall see on my side.<WH5869> My eyes shall see,<WH7200> and not as a stranger.<WH2114> "My heart<WH3629> is consumed<WH3615> within me.<WH2436>
If you say,<WH559> <WH7291> 'How we will persecute him!<WH8328>' because the root of the matter<WH1697> is found in me,<WH4672>
be afraid<WH1481> of the sword,<WH2719> for wrath<WH2534> brings the punishments<WH5771> of<WH6440> the sword,<WH2719> that you may know<WH3045> there is a judgment.<WH1779>"
